comments: Hes not all the hype that this page says that he is. Halevi is kinda rude to his students, especially if you dont understand the material. Hes also a goof; spends the class telling jokes and doesnt teach. Most of his essays/writings tend to be very vague and he expects his students to write like grad students.

comments: Personality as vivid as his green hair, such a down to earth dude. Class is just discussion & laid back, 99% of work is done outside of class (homework almost every night, but manageable). If you put effort into your work, he\'s an extremely fair grader. My perspective on writing/my writing style improved a lot as a result of this class. THE GOAT

comments: He\'s so down to earth and wants you to share your opinion. Sometimes the class would begin talking about something else and he would go along with it (pros and cons to that) But overall, his assignments are interesting and he lets you really guide the class. You can\'t slack and expect to pass the class, you really have to work for your grades

comments: He has a lot of charisma and is very bold. Even if I thought my writing was bad I would still get good grades on everything. You are given a sufficient amount of time to complete your work and the lectures are really fun and you only take notes if you see something you feel like you should remember. Really going to miss this class.

comments: Hakevi\'s class was a great challenge, but well worth my time and effort. He is one of the hardest Honors 101 teachers because he really makes you work for the A. He is very big on critical thinking and will challenge you to grow as a writer. There are a lot of assignments so it isn\'t that hard to get a B, but this was a truly enjoyable class.

Firmly believes in the importance of writing and expressing your opinion. Very confident, and very open to discussing anything. I highly recommend this professor. Won\'t let you down

comments: Professor Halevi provides an element of leadership that is unmatched by any professor I have ever had. The genuine concern for his students is unequivocal. He will make you work for your grade so do not expect an easy A. What you can expect is that he will prepare you for success in academia and the workforce. A true consummate professional.

comments: As an international student, English is not my first language. where i am from, the academic language is french and it was hard to learn english. Mr Halevi really gave me good feedback on all my papers and especially when he noticed that i was struggling because the french academic\'s writing is different much different from the american\'s.
